title: Number of Asian elephants

population.title: Population
population.content: A population is a group of individuals of the same species that live in the same geographic area. A species will often have multiple or many populations, each living in a different area.

subtitle: Estimates on wild mammal [populations](hover::biodiversity::population) tend to come with significant uncertainty. A complete time-series for the Asian elephant population is not available, however, it's estimated to have declined from approximately 100,000 in the early 20th century to approximately 45,000 today.
sourceDesc: Asian Elephant Specialist Group (AsESG); Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations
